_comment: Render baseline — expected per-frame metrics at specific capture frames. CI compares actual metrics against these thresholds. These values represent minimum acceptable metrics and must not be lowered without justification.

30.note: Frame 30: early boot — may not have rendering yet

60.note: Frame 60: logo scene should be loading

300.note: Frame 300: logo should be rendering if assets available

global._note: All global fields are enforced by verify_port.py. Raise thresholds as rendering improves, never lower.

pipeline._note: Pipeline requirements. Set require_textures=true once texture loading works, require_textured_shaders=true once TEV applies textures, etc. Each flag gates a pipeline stage check. Raise these as rendering progresses — never disable a requirement that was previously enabled.

_anti_cheat_note: Do not lower these thresholds. Global min_peak values ensure the rendering pipeline is functional. Per-frame thresholds should be raised as rendering improves, never lowered. Pipeline requirements gate each rendering stage. Changes to this file should be reviewed carefully.
